author: marioevz
content:
Hi all, we are preparing a new release for EEST and it contains four breaking changes regarding the fixtures:
- Cancun is now the latest deployed fork, and the development fork is now Prague (https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/489).
- Stable fixtures artifact fixtures.tar.gz has been renamed to fixtures_stable.tar.gz (https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/573)
- The "Blockchain Test Hive" fixture format has been renamed to "Blockchain Test Engine" and updated to more closely resemble the engine_newPayload format in the execution-apis specification (https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/prague.md#request) and now contains a single "params" field instead of multiple fields for each parameter (https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/687).
- Output folder for blockchain engine (hive) fixtures has been renamed from "blockchain_tests_hive" to "blockchain_tests_engine" (https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/687).

author: marioevz
content: We will be releasing later today!

author: draganrakita
content:
I have failed test that i think is incorrect. But would like a second oppinion.

Statetest and output from geth is here: https://gist.github.com/rakita/69ec4ee97920ab88ca1550baebe4bcf5
beneficiary balance is 30,000,000 ((price-base_fee)\*gas_limit) it consumes all of gas.

Test transaction is EOF create with invalid EOF format, when it fails validation, it consumes all gas but in spec it says: `If EOF header parsing or full container validation fails, transaction is considered valid and failing. Gas for initcode execution is not consumed, only intrinsic creation transaction costs are charged.`
